title.narrative: Guangxi Integrated Forestry Development and Conservation Project

description.narrative: The overall project development objective is to improve the effectiveness of forest management and institutional arrangements in timber production, watershed protection and nature reserves management in selected areas of the Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region (GZAR).

provider-org.narrative: International Bank for Reconstruction and Development

condition.narrative: Borrower shall ensure that all measures are taken to minimize potential social impacts of hill closure on local communities
Borrower shall ensure that sites for Protection Forests are selected in accordance with criteria acceptable to the Bank
Each NR Mgt Plan shall identify options for engaging local communities, no civil works or expenditures under part C.1 until WBagrees on NRM Plans all activities under C.1 to be conform to NRM Plans
Guidelines for karst management acceptable to the Bank shall be drafted
Nature Reserve Management Plans are prepared for each NR and submitted to the Bank
PPMO shall ensure that all plantations under part A of the project shall be carried out in accordance with afforestation modelsacceptable to the Bank
PPMO shall ensure that all project activities are carried out in accordance with the Env. Guidelines; MNDev. plan; Result P F andProc. FMPAI and Pest Mgt Plan
PPMO shall ensure that loan proceeds allocated to finance plantations be made to sub-borrowers under terms satisfactory to WB
PPMO shall ensure that sub-loan proposals are evaluated following criteria satisfactory to WB and that each PPMO establish by12/01/2007 and maintain a credit mgt system for M&E subloans
PPMO shall ensure that under Part C.3 communities are selected to receiving training on the basis of criteria acceptable to theBank.
PPMO shall not amend, suspend or waive EProt. Guidelines; MNDP, RPF, PFMPAI, Pest Mgt Plan without WB concurrence
PPMO to apply PIP in carrying out the project and shall not amend, suspend or waive PIP without WB agreement
PPMO to ensure loan and grant proceeds are used exclusively for financing eligible expenditures for purposes intended.
PPMO to ensure that prior to planting season each FF shall enter into contract satisfactory to WB with households and communities.
PPMO to furnish to the WB for its approval: (i) annual work program and budget for the next calendar year each Dec, 31, startingin2007; (ii) ensure activities are in accord with plan and budget
PPMO to implement training and extension services and forestry development strategy under part D in accordance with PIP and in amanner satisfactory to the Bank
The project implementing entity shall maintain until completion: (a) P Leading Grp; (b) P Coord.Grp; (c) PPMO; (d) County-PLG; (e)CPMO; (f) Nature Reserve - P Mgmt Grp; (g) Tec Sup Panel; (h)Biodiv.
Under part C. 2 the second site for biodiversity survey shall be selected of field assessment

title.narrative: Component four:Number of forestry staff and households trained under the project
Component two:Number of ha of multiple protection forests established andnumber of tons of carbon sequestered

target.value: 18,000ha of multiple protectin forests established and 30,000 ton carbon CERs sold.

actual.value: 18,010 ha of multiple protection forests established and 167.7 ton CO2 sequestered and traded.

title.narrative: Number of nature reserves within which key indicator species or limestone forest areas remain stable or increase
Component three: Number of new sites with high biodiversity value identified and protection initiated
Component one: Number of participating farm households reached (‘000HH)
Number of employees of participating Forest Farms no longer on payroll
Component four: Number of guidelines and technical advisory bulletins developed and disseminated
Component three: Project-supported nature reserves maintain a higher METT score than a sample of comparable non-project nature reserves
Component three: Kilometric abundance score for four forest-dependent pheasants in Maoershan Nature Reserve
Component three: Area affected by fires in Longshan Nature Reserve Donghong Section

target.value: Less than 3 ha affected by fire since start Yr. 4

title.narrative: Component three: Forest dependency score for birds in Damingshan Nature Reserve
Percent increase in vegetation cover (VC) in targeted watersheds
Component three: Number of Francoisi leaf monkeys in Nong Gang Nature Reserve
Component three: Number of slipper orchids along 19 fixed transects in Mulun Nature Reserve
Project-supported timber plantations achieve higher timber volume growth per hectare than non-project plantation areas
Component four:Provincial forest strategy formulated and adopted by Guangxi authorities.
Component three:Management effectiveness of five targeted nature reserves measured by average incremental scores on scorecard increases
